'''Art''' or '''artwork''' may refer to:

== ''Minecraft'' ==
* [[Concept art]] – artwork released to reveal conceptual development of ''[[Minecraft]]'' features.
* [[Key art]] – artwork released to promote ''[[Minecraft]]'' and its major updates.
* [[Programmer art]] – the look of ''Minecraft'' before the [[Texture Update]].
* {{ItemLink|Painting}} – item used to display artworks in-game. 

== Art style ==
* [[Tiny]] – a chibi-like art style stylizing characters with small bodies and large heads.
* Sketches – the look of pencil and paper used in concept art and the [[Minecraft: Mobestiary]].

== Crossovers ==

* [[Funko Pop]] – a style popularized by Funko, with large heads and dots for eyes.
* [[LEGO]] – a style popularized by The LEGO Group, with environments made of bricks and characters minifigures.
* [[YooTooz]] – a style used for vinyl figures, featuring a distinctive squinting eye.

== See also ==
* [[Mash-up pack]] – a combination of [[resource pack]]s and [[Marketplace#Worlds|worlds]].
* [[Music]] – a form of art to express auditory pleasure.
* [[Paint]] – a disambiguation page for a tool used in art or verb to describe the action of art.
* [[Texture pack (downloadable content)]] – downloadable replacement textures in Bedrock and Legacy Console editions which uses art to create.
